pageProps.contentHtml:
subharmonic functions

Let uuu be a continuous subharmonic function on C\CC that satisfies

lim sup⁡∣z∣→∞u(z)log⁡ ∣z∣≤0.\limsup_{\abs{z}\to\infty} \frac{u\p{z}}{\log\,\abs{z}} \leq 0.∣z∣→∞limsup​log∣z∣u(z)​≤0.

Show that uuu is constant on C\CC.
Solution.

Let ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0, and observe that if we set uε(z)=u(z)−εlog⁡ ∣z∣u_\epsilon\p{z} = u\p{z} - \epsilon\log\,\abs{z}uε​(z)=u(z)−εlog∣z∣, then uεu_\epsilonuε​ is still subharmonic and

uε(z)=(u(z)log⁡ ∣z∣−ε)log⁡ ∣z∣≤0u_\epsilon\p{z} = \p{\frac{u\p{z}}{\log\,\abs{z}} - \epsilon}\log\,\abs{z} \leq 0uε​(z)=(log∣z∣u(z)​−ε)log∣z∣≤0

for ∣z∣≥R\abs{z} \geq R∣z∣≥R for some R>0R > 0R>0, by assumption. Thus, by the maximum principle, it follows that uε(z)≤0u_\epsilon\p{z} \leq 0uε​(z)≤0 on ∣z∣≤R\abs{z} \leq R∣z∣≤R, hence on all of C\CC. Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0, we see that u(z)≤0u\p{z} \leq 0u(z)≤0 on C\CC. Thus,

lim sup⁡∣z∣→∞uε(z)=−∞,\limsup_{\abs{z}\to\infty} u_\epsilon\p{z} = -\infty,∣z∣→∞limsup​uε​(z)=−∞,

so by the maximum principle applied to a large annular region, we see that uε(z)u_\epsilon\p{z}uε​(z) must attain its maximum in ∂D\partial\D∂D. Thus, by the maximum principle applied to the unit disk,

sup⁡∣z∣≥1uε(z)=sup⁡z∈∂Duε(z)=sup⁡z∈∂Du(z)=sup⁡z∈Du(z),\sup_{\abs{z} \geq 1} u_\epsilon\p{z} = \sup_{z \in \partial\D} u_\epsilon\p{z} = \sup_{z \in \partial\D} u\p{z} = \sup_{z \in \D} u\p{z},∣z∣≥1sup​uε​(z)=z∈∂Dsup​uε​(z)=z∈∂Dsup​u(z)=z∈Dsup​u(z),

since uuu and uεu_\epsilonuε​ agree on ∂D\partial\D∂D. Hence, for ∣z∣≥1\abs{z} \geq 1∣z∣≥1,

u(z)=uε(z)+εlog⁡ ∣z∣≤sup⁡z∈Du(z)+εlog⁡ ∣z∣.u\p{z} = u_\epsilon\p{z} + \epsilon\log\,\abs{z} \leq \sup_{z \in \D} u\p{z} + \epsilon\log\,\abs{z}.u(z)=uε​(z)+εlog∣z∣≤z∈Dsup​u(z)+εlog∣z∣.

Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0 again, we see that u(z)u\p{z}u(z) must attain its maximum in D‾\cl{\D}D by continuity, so by the maximum principle again, uuu must be constant.
